headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Electronic Arts, Lockheed Martin, Carnival, Alibaba
summary: ↗️ Electronic Arts (EA): The videogame maker is going private for $52.5 billion in what it billed as the largest-ever private-equity backed buyout. Shares rose 4.5% Monday, while other video-game stocks such as Roblox (RBLX) and Take-Two Interactive Software (TTWO) also moved higher on the day.

headline: U.S. defense stocks jump on Pentagon’s plan to double missile production
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. defense stocks have rallied Monday premarket after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Pentagon has outlined an aggressive push to expand missile production, a move aimed at preparing for potential conflict with China.

raw.headline: U.S. defense stocks jump on Pentagon’s plan to double missile production

headline: Pentagon Pushes to Double Missile Production for Potential China Conflict
summary: The Pentagon, alarmed at the low weapons stockpiles the U.S. would have on hand for a potential future conflict with China, is urging its missile suppliers to double or even quadruple production rates on a breakneck schedule.  The push to speed production of the critical weapons in the highest demand has played out through a series of high-level meetings between Pentagon leaders and senior representatives from several U.S. missile makers, according to people familiar with the matter.  The department summoned top missile suppliers to a June roundtable at the Pentagon to kick off the industry effort.

raw.headline: Pentagon Pushes to Double Missile Production for Potential China Conflict

The department summoned top missile suppliers to a June roundtable at the Pentagon to kick off the industry effort.

headline: Lunar Lander Propulsion System Market Analysis and Forecast Report 2025-2040 | Advancements in Material Science for Next-Generation Lunar Lander Thruster Pumps
summary: The lunar lander propulsion system market is rapidly evolving, driven by the growing demand for precise and reliable propulsion technologies integral to lunar exploration missions. Key players such as L3Harris, Northrop Grumman, Moog Inc., and Lockheed Martin propel market growth through innovative solutions like chemical thrusters and electric propulsion systems. Increased investments from space agencies and private enterprises are fueling advancements in fuel efficiency and mission flexibility
